page.title: 15Education
page.content: The environmental studies which the lower juniors undertake include visits to churches, abbeys, museums, and shopping centres.These studies are undertaken to a greater depth,with more maths,science,and geography developing from the visit.Children visit the chosen area in class groups. At a later date small groups travel in teachers cars for further visits in the evenings.The lower juniors begin team games of netball and football,and much more emphasis is placed upon science with the use of the Nuffield Science Scheme,amongst others. Recorders are played and the children begin to study formal notation. A Fletcher Mathematics Scheme is begun in the infant department and continues throughout the school.
